segments.pli: “Rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anabhijānaṃ aparijānaṃ avirājayaṃ appajahaṃ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya;
segments.en: “Mendicants, without directly knowing and completely understanding form, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.

segments.pli: vedanaṃ anabhijānaṃ aparijānaṃ avirājayaṃ appajahaṃ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya;
segments.en: Without directly knowing and completely understanding feeling …

segments.pli: saṅkhāre anabhijānaṃ aparijānaṃ avirājayaṃ appajahaṃ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya;
viññāṇaṃ anabhijānaṃ aparijānaṃ avirājayaṃ appajahaṃ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya.
segments.en: consciousness, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.

segments.pli: Rūpañca kho, bhikkhave, abhijānaṃ parijānaṃ virājayaṃ pajahaṃ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāya;
segments.en: By directly knowing and completely understanding form, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
By directly knowing and completely understanding feeling …

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ abhijānaṃ parijānaṃ virājayaṃ pajahaṃ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.
segments.en: consciousness, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.”

suttaplex.blurb: Only by directly knowing the aggregates can one end suffering.
